concepts.title: Variables, Coefficients and Terms
concepts.content: A variable is a letter representing an unknown or changing quantity. In 3n+1, n is the variable. The coefficient is the number multiplying the variable: in 4xÂ², the coefficient of xÂ² is 4. In -x, the coefficient of x is -1. A term is an expression where multiplication is the only operation.

examples.text: 3n+1: n is variable, pattern for number of sticks

keyPoints: Variable: a letter representing a changing quantity
Coefficient: the number multiplying the variable
In -x, the coefficient of x is -1 (not 1)
Term: expression with only multiplication operation
3n+1, 2x+3y, 2(l+b) are all algebraic expressions

concepts.title: Types: Monomial, Binomial, Trinomial, Polynomial
concepts.content: Expressions are named by their number of terms. Monomial: 1 term (e.g., 4x, 5m/6). Binomial: 2 terms (e.g., 2x-3y). Trinomial: 3 terms (e.g., xÂ²-5x+6). Polynomial: more than 3 terms. Like terms have the same variable with the same power; unlike terms cannot be directly added.
keyPoints: Monomial: 1 term; Binomial: 2 terms; Trinomial: 3 terms
Polynomial: more than 3 terms
Like terms: same variable, same power (e.g., 2x and 5x)
Unlike terms: different variables or powers (e.g., 7xy and 9yÂ²)
Only like terms can be added or subtracted directly
concepts.funFact: ðŸ“Š The word 'polynomial' comes from Greek: 'poly' = many, 'nomial' = term. Quadratic equations are degree-2 polynomials!

concepts.title: Addition of Algebraic Expressions
concepts.content: To add algebraic expressions, add the coefficients of like terms. For example, 3x + 4x = 7x (add coefficients: 3+4=7). Unlike terms cannot be simplified further: 3x + 4y stays as 3x + 4y. Use horizontal arrangement or vertical arrangement.
keyPoints: Add coefficients of like terms
Unlike terms cannot be combined
Horizontal method: group like terms, then add
Vertical method: write like terms in columns, add
concepts.funFact: ðŸŽ Adding algebraic terms is like adding apples and mangoes â€” you can only add apples with apples: 3x + 4x = 7x!

concepts.title: Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions
concepts.content: To subtract algebraic expressions, add the additive inverse. Change the sign of every term in the expression being subtracted, then add. For example: (16x+23y+12z) - (9x-27y+14z) = 16x+23y+12z - 9x+27y-14z = 7x+50y-2z.

examples.text: Change signs of all terms being subtracted
Vertical method: write second expression, change all signs, add

keyPoints: Subtraction = add the additive inverse
Change sign of EVERY term in the expression subtracted
-(3xy-16z) = -3xy+16z (signs flipped)
Then add the resulting expressions normally
Vertical method: write with opposite signs and add
concepts.funFact: ðŸ”„ The trick of 'change the sign and add' makes subtraction easy â€” just remember to change ALL signs in the bracket!

concepts.title: Multiplication and Solving Equations

keyPoints: Monomial Ã— monomial: multiply signs, coefficients, then variables
Use distributive law for binomial Ã— monomial
Binomial Ã— binomial: multiply each term of first by each term of second
Equation solving: transpose (change sign when crossing =)

keyConcepts: Coefficient: number multiplying the variable (e.g., in -15t, coefficient is -15)
Types: Monomial(1 term), Binomial(2), Trinomial(3), Polynomial(>3)
Like terms: same variable with same power â€” only these can be added/subtracted
Addition: add coefficients of like terms
Subtraction: change all signs of expression being subtracted, then add
Multiplication: multiply coefficients, then variables using laws of indices
commonMisconceptions: 3x + 4y = 7xy â€” FALSE, unlike terms cannot be combined
